page.title: 10HOUSING IN AMMANFORD
page.content: Most of the housing in the area was built before WWI, they were used by the local coal and steel workers. Many of these houses have been modernised and improved recently; other properties have been demolished for new developments. A great deal of house building was carried out in the 50's and 60's. The road patterns of that period have a circular and diagonal design. Heol Wallasey, Myddynfych, Brynhafod, Parcyrhun Est. and Maesydail are council estates, typical of that period. Carregamman Est. was built of pre-fab units immediately after WWII. Most recent developments have been on the outskirts of Ammanford. Private housing ests. have been built since the late 60's; Wernoleu,Maesycoed and Penydre.
